property.name: text
property.value:
State codes: 0 Listening L; 1 Master M; 2 Slave S; 3 Passive P; 4 Pre-Master PM; 5 Uncalibrated U DB Update codes: 0=M1, 1=P1, 2=M2, 3=S1, 4=P2, 5=M3, 255=error
BMC parameters: priority (priority1), class (clockClass), variance (stand-in for accuracy, variance, prioiry2), identity.

property.name: text
property.value: parseKey: 0 => match in fmDB slot 0 1 => match in fmDB slot 1 2 => match in fmDB slot 2 255 => no match

property.name: text
property.value: Messages in FM data sets are removed when: -considered but not selected for erbest 9.3.2.3 -if no update occurs within AnnounceReceiptInterval (should be added to 9.3.2.3) Both are done in actor "updateWindowsSlotCounts"

property.name: text
property.value: Datasets: default: priority, class, variance, identity current: stepsRemoved parent: parentIdentity, parentPort, gmPriority, gmClass, gmVariance, gmIdentity port: portState

property.name: text
text
property.value:
Clauses 9.2.6.8, 9.3.2.3, 9.5.1, and 9.6 require that: 1-Updates to port state and data sets be atomic and 2-Computation of erbest and ebest needed for this be included in the same atomic process. In addition the sending of announce messages must be atomic.
This implies that 1: The processMessages and processAI (AI is state change event) each be atomic 2: The processAI (state change event) includes the following actors: updateWindowsSlotCount, computeERBEST, recommendedState, updateDataSetsAndState updateParentDataSets and associated actors 3: An announce receipt timeout (art event) also triggers the actors: updateDataSetsAndState updateParentDataSets and associated actors and this process must be atomic 4: Sending of announce messages must be atomic 4: Message inputs, AI (state change event), and art are all asynchronous
To do this: 1- processMessages, processAI, send announce, and art each generate distinct completion events 2- The stateChangeEventManagement actor ensures that these processes are atomic and that other process inputs during an atomic process are not lost.

property.name: text
property.value: If more than one event is pending the precedence in execution is: ART > AI > SEND > IN replaced starting march 20 by IN > ART > AI > SEND

property.name: text
property.value: Announce Message Filter and Foreign Master Database

property.name: text
property.value: PROCESS AI: Announce Interval State Change Event and Port Database Update

property.name: text
property.value: The "gap" ensures that recommended state is computed atomically using the most recent values or erbest from all clock ports

property.name: text
property.value: The "gap" ensures that external caused updates to clock attributes are computed atomically with respect to other AI computations.

property.name: text
property.value: LAST VISITED: March30, 2014 9:35 AM add parameter for 255 limit and extend rogue frame semantics

property.name: text
property.value: 9523correction: =true implies that this port is receiving msgs from another port on the same clock and should be placed in the passive state =false implies that either such messages are NOT being received OT that this is the port with the lowest port number receiving such messages

property.name: text
text
property.value: resets windows slot to 0 for new index value

display.name: Check and clear old fmDB slots

property.name: text
property.value: Increment timeoutCounts. If clearState is true then all slots where the timeoutCount is greater than the announceTimeoutThreshold will be initialized.

property.name: text
text
property.value:
Clause 9.2.6.11 Stop if in INIT, PRE-MASTER,FAULTY,DISABKED, or MASTER Start when entering LISTEN< UNCAL, SLAVE, PASSIVE RESET if msessage from parent or message from clock that caused passive state NOTE that in the case of a 9523 event message the msg is not processed but a 9523 event is generated
State codes: 0 Listening L; 1 Master M; 2 Slave S; 3 Passive P; 4 Pre-Master PM; 5 Uncalibrated U
Increment announceReceiptTimeout. If it exceeds announceReceiptThreshold generate announceTimeoutEvent

property.name: text
property.value: TRUE => permit timeout (listening,slave, (U)calibrate, passive) FALSE => supress timeout (master, premaster) 9.2.6.11

property.name: text
property.value: TRUE => reset on state change EXCEPT when entering premaster or master FALSE => no reste same state ustep delay to ensure update occurs AFTER action of timeout increment mechanism above 9.2.6.11c

property.name: text
property.value: This section increments the AI timeout counter modulo the AI timeout threshold 9.2.6.11b

property.name: text
property.value: For a AI timout event to occur: 9.2.6.11 A- the mechanism must generate a signal when value > threshold B- current state must NOT be premaster or master TRUE => permit timeout (listening,slave, uncalibrate, passive) FALSE => supress timeout (master, premaster)

property.value: MSG from parent clock causes event when in uncal or slave 9.2.6.11a

property.name: text
property.value: MSG from clock that cause the passive state causes event when in passive 9.2.6.11d

property.name: text
property.value: TRUE => permit timeout (listening,slave, uncalibrate, passive) FALSE => supress timeout (master, premaster) 9.2.6.11

text
property.value: The announce receive timeout event should follow 9.2.6.11. When using configured state ART operation is modified in updateDataSets

property.name: text
property.value:
Checks to see if message from THIS clock AND port. If TRUE Discard per 9.3.2.5a if true also export {portNum, sending portNum, portState} ( implementation of 9.5.2.3)
If FALSE (not from this clock) -do not discard (depending on rogue frame detector) -do not export

property.name: text

property.value: Checks to see if fmDB slot is empty

property.value: TRUE: =>rogue frame or update erbest detected, generate doneProcessing trigger FALSE: =>NO rogue frames, continue processing

property.name: text
text
property.value:
Checks to see if input message is an update of erbest. If so do the update and generate a complete. If not an update then process message for addition to foreitn master database
Clause 9.5.3 and Fig 29. Modified 3/21/14 to limit to slave or uncalibrated state check per Fig 29. Data set update done at clock level.

property.name: text
text
property.value: State codes: 0 Listening L; 1 Master M; 2 Slave S; 3 Passive P; 4 Pre-Master PM; 5 Uncalibrated U

property.name: text
property.value:
9.3.2.3c requires that in the SLAVE state the previous value of erbest shall be inlcuded in the computation of a new erbest EXCEPT if a more recent Announce message from the same port as erbest has been received in which case that message is used. HOWEVER if an announceReceiptTimeout event occurs then the previous erbest shall not be used.
This actor: 1-always includes some version of erbest. 2-IF an announceReceiptTimeout event has occured the value of erbest will be the "default" erbest which is a message with all fields 255. 3-Otherwise erbest will always be the most recent value. This is implemented in the actor Filter messages and update FM DB.
To make this work if the newly completed erbest is from slots 0, 1, or 2 then that value must be written into erbest and the slot from which it was taken must be initialized.
The specification of 9.3.2.3c is extended to include the Passive and Uncalibrated states if the value of "extend9323c" is true.

property.name: text
property.value: To make the computation of erbest and the initialization of FM DB slots correct the "slot number" must be 255

property.name: text
property.value:
State codes: 0 Listening L; 1 Master M; 2 Slave S; 3 Passive P; 4 Pre-Master PM; 5 Uncalibrated U
RECOMMENDED State Codes (fig 26): 0=M1, 1=P1, 2=M2, 3=S1, 4=P2, 5=M3, 255 =error

property.name: text
property.value: NO PORT DEPENDENT CODE IN THIS ACTOR

property.name: text
property.value:
Data set updates for current and parent dataset due to an announceReceiptTimeout per 9.2.6.11 are done at the clock rather than the port level after all state changes in all ports are complete. Otherwise these datasets are updated in this actor.
port dataset (portState) done after final state is determined in this actor

property.name: text
property.value: This portion of the model implements the logic of Figure 23 (PTP state machine) In effect this updates the port data set

property.name: text
property.value: By 9.2.6.10 for M1 or M2, N = 0 i.e. move directly to master

property.name: text
property.value: By 9.2.6.10 for M3, N = stepsRemoved+1 (note if new master arrives prior to N intervals as seen by presence of newEBEST event then restart with new stepsRemoved IF restartN is true)

property.name: text
property.value: Since we have not implemented any functions in the uncalibrated state the port transitions directly to the slave state.

property.name: text
text
property.value: The trial configured state option is active when all of the following are true -useConfiguredState

property.name: text
property.value: -portState output updates portState variable in port dataset -displayState output updates text in the port's position in the clockActor icon -updateDataSetCode is the input to the updateParentDataSet actor that updates the parent and current (only stepsRemoved in current) datasets. portState is a portDataSet member. code values: {6,PortNum} = listening state, no updates, portState =0 {0,portNum} = update to D0 (M1 or M2 fig 26), portState = 1 master {1,portNum} = update to ebest by slave port (S1 of fig 26), portState = 2 slave {3,portNum} = no dataset update (P1 or P2 fig 26), portState = 3 passive {5,portNum} = 9.2.6.11 qualified (M3 of fig 26) , no dataset update portState = 1 master or 4 pre-master 2 = when due to announce receipt timeout (M1 or M3 9.2.6.11) handled separately RECOMMENDED state codes: 0=M1, 1=P1, 2=M2, 3=S1, 4=P2, 5=M3, 6= Listening, 255=error

property.name: text
property.value: The announce receive timeout event should should follow 9.2.6.11 except that configured rather than normal values are used.

entity.name: StringConst
entity.doc: Create a constant sequence with a string value.

property.name: text
property.value:
The fundamental array is the Announce message. It has two "extra fields" that are used for implementation specific purposes in various portions of the simulator to avoid having to change array lengths. In the following description the number in front of the identifier is the array element number.
Announce messafe format: {0:sequenceNum, 1:sourceIdentity, 2:sourcePort, 3:gmPriority, 4:gmClass, 5:gmVariance, 6:gmIdentity}, 7:stepsRemoved, 8:receivingIdentity, 9:receivingPort, 10:extra0, 11:extra1}
The extra fields are defined as follows: -on-the-wire: extra1 contains the number of TC or ordinary bridges the message has traversed (info only) -computing ERBEST: 10:extra0 = slotNumber, 11:extra1 = code (0=better, 1=better by topology, 2=error) -state computation: 10:extra0 = decision code, 11:extra1 = state
Announce messages: 9.5.8.1, 7.37, 13.3.1, and 13.5.1 SEND ONLY IF IN MASTER STATE

property.name: text
property.value: Clause 9.5.8 Generates a trigger event to send announce messages Randomization can be inhibited. Randomization is +- 30% of AI
